The initial report from the BlueLivesMat: blue blog and New York Post article claimed that two NYPD officers were denied service at a Dunkin' Donuts in Brooklyn.
The president of the Detectives: Endowment Association, Michael Palladino, condemned the incident and called for a boycott of Dunkin' Donuts until an apology was issued.
The manager of the Dunkin: Donuts store stated that the officers were standing in the pickup area instead of the ordering line, and therefore did not place an order.
The New York Post later reported that a: Donuts had apologized to one of the involved officers, but it was unclear which version of events was accurate.
